subject: Re: [junit] Global variable?
msgSnippet: ... Well, that reload classes button means that classes are reloaded for each test /run/, and not for each individual test. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
messageBody:
Kevin Duffey wrote:
> I could be wrong. There is a UI that you can select
> "reload...". Part of the JUnit GUI runner I think, in
> which case each TestCase get's it's own classloader
> instance each time it runs. I thought I read each run
> get's its own loader instance anyway to "sandbox" it
> so that across runs one testcase run can not affect
> another testcase run. However, again, I may be wrong
> on this.

Well, that "reload classes" button means that classes are reloaded for
each test /run/, and not for each individual test.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
